title: Covert Welfare Check as Damage Control (EA734 & EA820)

﻿EVIDENCE WRITE-UP Title: Covert Welfare Check as Damage Control: Sussex Police Turn Up Unexpectedly (17 May 2025, 17:33) File Reference: SUSSEX_POLICE_TURN_UP_UNEXPECTED_17-05-25_17-33_otter_ai.txt Contradiction Tags: SUSSEX_POLICE_NO_SAFEGUARDING_CONTACT, DAMAGE_CONTROL_VISIT, INSTITUTIONAL_GASLIGHTING, LATE_INTERVENTION_AFTER_SUICIDE, DISPLACEMENT_TACTICS Timeline Threads:
* Crowbarring Myself Justice
* They Saw, Paused, Reflected — and Chose Death
* Crime Ref 47240214305 Thread
________________


SUMMARY
On 17 May 2025, Sussex Police officers Amy (EA734) and Sam (EA820) arrived unannounced at Ben Carter’s residence under the pretext of a welfare check. This came more than six weeks after Ben’s documented suicide attempt on 6 April 2025, for which no physical police follow-up had occurred. The visit took place shortly after the user began raising formal complaints with the IOPC, the CPS, and the public, intensifying exposure of Sussex Police's misconduct.
This recording shows officers claiming no knowledge of Ben's case or its context, while simultaneously extracting information about suicidal ideation and confirming that a report will now be filed. The contradiction between thi

contradictions: They Saw, Paused, Reflected — and Chose Death

policy_reference.policy: College of Policing — Responding to Suicidal Risk

notes: Unannounced visit 41 days after suicide attempt; 20 days after MEAC/MASH discussion. Officers unfamiliar with case; emphasize support over accountability.
proof_needed: Safeguarding referral / risk log generated at visit
